column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column7: Cochlear generated $1.9 billion in revenues in 2023.

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: Cochlear's enterprise risk management approach includes an assessment of its physical climate-related risks (riverine and urban flood, extreme heat, cyclones and wildfires). It also includes the assessment of potential climate-related risks to critical production-related suppliers and critical business infrastructure providers.

Approach to tax
column13: Cochlear's tax strategy reflects the generation of intellectual property that occurs primarily in Australia. The assets, risks and functions of implementing that strategy mean that most of Cochlear's corporate income tax is paid in Australia.

column6: Reduction of energy consumption
column13: Cochlear implements initiatives to reduce its fossil fuel use and energy consumption. For example, Cochlear replaced the petrol van used to transport production components, consumables and finished goods between its Sydney facilities with an electric van. Cochlear also renovated the air conditioning system at its Macquarie University site, representing annual savings of around 360 MWh, almost 8% of the annual consumption.
column20: Fossil fuel, energy consumption, petrol van

column6: Reductions in energy requirements of products and services
column13: Cochlear's Environmental Policy sets out its commitment to managing and reducing its impact on the global environment. Cochlear works closely with its partners and suppliers to monitor its environmental performance across its operations and the value chain.
